results.title: Contexts of development
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discusses the theory of “context” where each child is unique (biological context), but part of the environment (immediate, socio-economic and cultural contexts).

results.title: George and Toula
results.creator_credit: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A portrait of a marriage within the Greek community. George is Greek-born and Toula second-generation Australian. Toula has had a tertiary education and works in social services. She experiences much greater ambivalence about the traditions in which she was raised than her husband. The film is designed to show how an ethnic community shapes the lives of its members.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.description:

She experiences much greater ambivalence about the traditions in which she was raised than her husband. The film is designed to show how an ethnic community shapes the lives of its members.

results.title: Mamie & Maggie
results.creator_credit: Eulea Kiraly, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eulea Kiraly pays tribute to her grandmothers Maggie and Mamie, who are a source of comfort, inspiration and resilience. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Tuggeranong Arts Centre.

results.title: Child development
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Time to grow”.
Introduces the series, defines developmental psychology, provides a brief historical overview, and poses many of the questions discussed in later programs.

results.title: My family
results.brief_description: Salma gives a first-hand account of being a refugee. Fleeing the conflict in Sudan, she talks about the pain and anxiety of her journey to Australia, as well as the gratitude she feels for her new country.
results.description: Salma gives a first-hand account of being a refugee. Fleeing the conflict in Sudan, she talks about the pain and anxiety of her journey to Australia, as well as the gratitude she feels for her new country.

results.title: Tell me a story (Canberra) : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: This compilation of eleven stories, created by Canberra locals, was the culmination of ACMI’s ‘Train the trainer’ workshops. The stories, mostly biographical, cover a wide range of topics but are mostly concerned with beloved family members and life changing events.

results.title: Minh: a Vietnamese
results.creator_credit: Nick Torrens, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A look at the life of a Vietnamese refugee in Australia. Minh talks about his life and hopes for his children in his new country.
